name: Set Float Parameter (Event Tick)
description: Real-time MetaSounds parameter update via Blueprint lifecycle. Event Tick fires every frame, calling Set Float Parameter on an Audio Component to push a float variable into the MetaSound graph by name. Use for knobs, sliders, game state values that need continuous updates. Scales to multiple parameters by chaining Set Float Parameter calls.
author: Matt Spendlove (msp)
requires: Audio Component playing a MetaSound Source with named float inputs
Blueprint float variable matching the parameter to update

nodes.comment: Fires every frame — every tick of the gameplay loop checks and pushes values
In Name must match MetaSound graph input name exactly (case-sensitive)
Chain exec → exec for each parameter. Same Audio Component target.
Any float graph input can be driven this way — just match the name

variables.name: Audio
variables.description: Reference to the Audio Component playing the MetaSound Source

variables.name: Mixer Sub
variables.description: Sub-oscillator mix level — bind to UI slider or game state

notes: Chain as many Set Float Parameter calls as needed — one per MetaSound input to control. In Name must match the graph input name exactly (case-sensitive). Also available: Set Int Parameter, Set Bool Parameter, Set String Parameter, Execute Trigger Parameter. Consider using a Timer instead of Event Tick if you don't need 60fps updates.
